Detailed Description

Class DynamicObject. A Class to track the GPU time from different part of the program Also includes a log to print all the times

Member Function Documentation

void DynamicObject::Import ( const char *  filename,
const glm::mat4 &  TransformationMatrix 
)

Load an MD2 model from file.

Load an MD2 model from file.

Note: MD2 format stores model's data in little-endian ordering. On big-endian machines, you'll have to perform proper conversions.

filename the name of the model to be loaded TransformationMatrix a Matrix with all the transformations to be made to the model

void DynamicObject::Animate ( float  time  ) 

Calculate the current frame in animation.

Calculate the current frame in animation beginning at frame 'start' and ending at frame 'end', given interpolation percent. interp will be reseted to 0.0 if the next frame is reached.

time is the time elapsed from the previos time

Definition at line 415 of file DynamicObject.cpp.

00416 {
00417         if(m_fInterpolation <= 0.0f)
00418                 m_fInterpolation  = 0.0f;
00419         
00420         m_fInterpolation += time * m_fAnimationVelocity;
00421 
00422         if ((m_iFrame < m_iStart) || (m_iFrame > m_iEnd))
00423         m_iFrame = m_iStart;
00424 
00425         if (m_fInterpolation >= 1.0f)
00426         {
00427                 /* Move to next frame */
00428                 m_fInterpolation = 0.0f;
00429                 (m_iFrame)++;
00430 
00431                 if (m_iFrame >= m_iEnd)
00432                         m_iFrame = m_iStart;
00433         }
00434 }
